results.title: The Lord Mayor
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Chris McGill
results.brief_description: Who is at the centre of the administration of a big city? With this film the viewer spends a day in the company of the Lord Mayor of Sydney, Alderman Sir Nicholas Shehadie, OBE. Narrated by John Laws.

results.title: The Lorax (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: DePatie-Freleng Enterprises, Isadore Freleng and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Presents the story from the book “The Lorax” by Dr. Seuss. A fanciful tale with a serious theme: clean up the environment before it’s too late. In this delightful story the student is introduced to the needs of everyman. And the Lorax? Who is he and what does he do? Only Dr. Seuss can describe the creature - which he does with typical Seussian logic.

results.title: The Lopsided wheel
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Films, L. Richard Ellison and Bedrick Rogers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Around Us”.
The development of the wheel is illustrated from its invention to its use in computer machinery. Wheels of all kinds are shown and their common relation to certain laws of energy. This film highlights the problems created by wheels in the United States and other industrialised nations where there are too many, and in underdeveloped countries where there are not enough.

results.title: The Looney, looney, looney Bugs Bunny movie
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Isadore Freleng
results.brief_description: A feature length film containing some of Friz Freleng’s award winning cartoons starring those wonderful cartoon character creations of Freleng’s including Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, Pepe Le Pew, Porky Pig, Daffy Duck, Tweety Pie and Sylvester. The film is presented as part of an Award Ceremony honouring the classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes characters beginning with Bugs Bunny in an Academy Award winning cartoon short “Knighty knight Bugs”. The program is then divided into three acts: Act I - “Satan’s waitin’” starring Yosemite Sam; Act II - “The Unmentionables” starring Bugs Bunny as Elegant Ness, co-starring Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety Pie and Sylvester along with the notorious Rocky and his gang; Act III - The Oswald Awards hosted by Bugs Bunny (a take on the Academy Awards) showing cartoon highlights of the nominees in their starring performances, including Big Bad Wolf and the Three little bops. Classic cartoons, great family entertainment. Majority of voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: The Loon's necklace
results.brief_description: A re-creation of a legend of the Indians of British Colombia, using carved ceremonial masks of the Indians and animated drawings. The loon is a North American water bird. The story tells of Kelora, a blind medicine man. During a hard winter, his village suffers from famine, and is attacked by hungry wolves. Using his magic bow, Kelora is able to kill the wolves. In Spring, Kelora seeks out the loon, his “father”, and the loon gives him the power to see. In gratitude Kelora takes his most precious possession, a bead necklace, and throws it round the loon’s neck. That is how the loon came to get his collar of bright feathers.

results.title: The Longhouse people
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Allan Wargon
results.brief_description: The life and religious ceremonies of the Longhouse people - Iriquois Indians who adhere to the old religion. We see how the Iroquois of today, although fully adapted to the ways of the white people, still maintain a link with their proud past through observance of the customs and beliefs of their forefathers. Highlights of the film show an outdoor dance in supplication for rain, a healing ceremony performed by men of the False-Face Society and a dance in celebration of a newly chosen chief.

results.title: The Longest day
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions, Darryl F. Zanuck, Andrew Marton, Ken Annakin, Bernhard Wicki and Gerd Oswald
results.brief_description: Based on Cornelius Ryan’s compilation of interviews with D Day survivors, the film is broken into three sections- the Allied preparations for invasion, a faithful recreation of the movement of an Armada across the English Channel, and culminating in the attack on Normandy beaches. Intercut with these sequences is the response by German soldiers which are subtitled and directed by Bernhard Wicki. One of the most ambitious war films ever made, ‘The Longest day’ features 48 international stars, 4 directors, and won 2 Academy Awards for Special Effects and Cinematography, and was nominated for Best Picture.

results.title: The Long way back
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Donald Ginsberg
results.brief_description: This film shows how the mental health volunteer fits into the treatment of mental illness. It shows that patients in a mental hospital respond more quickly to treatment if kept in touch with the outside world. A film of importance to mature men and women who may wish to offer their services as volunteers. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: The Long war
results.creator_credit: Look Television Productions, Will Davies, Bee Reynolds and Peter Butt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “When the war came to Australia”.
In this final episode, Australians must face the consequences of over six years of war - a toll of shattered limbs, lives and unrealised dreams. After victory in the Pacific, it is a weary nation that welcomes its soldiers home. The war years have changed for ever the way Australians see themselves, both individually, particularly with respect to the relationships between the sexes, and as a nation looking to America and Asia instead of to Britain. Individuals comment on what the war meant to the average Aussie and how it affected their lives.
